Authors: Xiao He, Jun-Hong Dong, changlin zhao
Title:
Morphological and molecular identification of a new species
of Trulla (Steccherinaceae, Polyporales) from southern China
Keywords:
Molecular phylogeny, taxonomy, wood-inhabiting fungi,
Yunnan province.
Abstract:
A new wood-inhabiting fungal species, Trulla yunnanensis
spp. nov., is described based on morphological and molecular characters.
Trulla yunnanensis is characterized by annual, laterally stipitate
basidiomata with light brownish hymenial surface and a dimitic hyphal
system with clamped generative hyphae and cylindrical, hyaline,
thin-walled, smooth basidiospores (3.5  4.5 ´ 1.5  1.9 µm). Sequences of
ITS and nLSU nrRNA gene regions of the studied samples were generated,
and phylogenetic analyses were performed with maximum likelihood,
maximum parsimony and bayesian inference methods. The phylogenetic
analyses based on molecular data of ITS and ITS+nLSU sequences in
Steccherinaceae showed that Trulla yunnanensis nested into Trulla and
then grouped with T. dentipora and T. duracina. Further phylogeny
inferred from ITS sequences among Trulla revealed that Trulla
yunnanensis formed a monophyletic entity with a high support (100% BS,
100% BP and 1.00 BPP).
